<@U03TY4YJU4X>: Hi, I want to report a new issue. Please check the details.
*Issue:* `TPT Funnel Not Loading`
*Topic:* `Pet Quiz`
*Description:* `Replication: In incognito mode user access the TPT funnel - number of pups page. 

Current behaviour: periodically the header and footer are loaded, but not the content of the page or continue button.

Expected behaviour: funnel should load

Additional data: This was assumed to be resolved here: <https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C042XGZUQKT/p1756475904886269> (Wunderkind cookie issue).`
*Expected behaviour:* `Funnel step 1 is shown`
*Actual behaviour:* `Funnel step one is not loaded (see aboeve)`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-issue

*Topic:* `Checkout`
*Description:* `Hey team

It seems like FE is calling cart-abandonment api with wrong data and it's sending breed_size_slug in breed_slug`

Hey Mori :wave:,
We send the size value only if the Breed is selected as Unknown, which was the initial agreement/implementation.

`breed_slug: _quizData_?.unknownBreed ? _quizData_.breedSize : _quizData_?.breed`

elements.text:

<@U0177S413PC>: Hi, I want to report a new issue. Please check the details.
*Issue:* `Invalid Delivery Day `
*Topic:* `Delivery Date and Cadence`
*Description:* `This customer 5682601 was previously an Air-Dried customer receiving their box on Mondays (only available for Air-Dried customers) and changed their plan to a Fresh plan. However, they still had a Monday delivery day which is not a valid delivery day option for Fresh customers. Can we look into why their delivery date was not reassigned?`
*Expected behaviour:* `Not allowing Monday delivery day option for Fresh customer`
*Actual behaviour:* `Customer delivery day did not change when they changed plan to Fresh `

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-issue

_thread_replies.text:
<@U0177S413PC> because this user was on Tuesday delivery right after switching their plan to fresh, I suggest to put them back on Tuesday for future deliveries

Regarding the issue itself:
We know that this invalid delivery option has been set when user was rescheduling their delivery using reschedule calendar in my-deliveries dashboard. We have identified one edge case scenario that would allow user to select wrong delivery option after switching their plan, if they kept multiple browser tabs open.

Considering above, is that the only case where you spotted the wrong delivery option so far? We are trying to understand how often this could happen

_thread_replies.text:
I've inspected logs on my end for traces of similar activity, and in last 60 days we captured only one such instance, the one that you have reported this time. Unfortunately our logs have only 60 days range

We are working with a backend team on invalidating user attempts to patch their subscription with a wrong delivery option. Our app must error out in such attempts, without getting into technical details, these are not typical scenarios users will end up in, and we are ok with displaying error on page

I will resolve this now, and of course please inform us in future if you stumble upon such issue again

_thread_replies.text:
Hey Laurent :wave:,
Regarding the change-plan-confirmation screen, we were making a change related to a tech initiative (pricing calculation endpoint migration) which created a discrepancy between the price values on T&C and Order summary. So we reverted that specific change.

But even after the revert, we noticed another price discrepancy, as the price displayed on the T&C text is wrongly displaying the price with discount if the subscription has an active voucher. And we will be mitigating this discrepancy as part of the pricing calculation endpoint migration tickets in this sprint.

elements.text:
,
Regarding the change-plan-confirmation screen, we were making a change related to a tech initiative (pricing calculation endpoint migration) which created a discrepancy between the price values on T&C and Order summary. So we reverted that specific change.

But even after the revert, we noticed another price discrepancy, as the price displayed on the T&C text is wrongly displaying the price with discount if the subscription has an active voucher. And we will be mitigating this discrepancy as part of the pricing calculation endpoint migration tickets in this sprint.

_thread_replies.text: Regarding order summary, we think this is a separate issue and so far we couldn't reproduce it with our test accounts. Would be great if you can share the impacted subscriptionId.

elements.text: Regarding order summary, we think this is a separate issue and so far we couldn't reproduce it with our test accounts. Would be great if you can share the impacted subscriptionId.

_thread_replies.text:
from <@U8F7ZDAPM>

Hey team, sharing this for visibility. We've just resolved an issue yesterday morning that has to do with Wunderkind.

*TLDR:* Wunderkind was injecting a huge cookie into users' browsers which causes API requests to fail. We've contacted the Wunderkind team and they've reduced the cookie size yesterday morning which seems to have fully resolved the issue. Unfortunately it's hard for us to get a good understanding of the impact but what we know is that it caused random APIs to fail for ~1000 users from July 30th - Aug 28th

*What was the issue?*
We noticed that there was spike of failures across all of our backend requests starting July 30th and identified that it's being caused by Wunderkind injecting a huge cookie into the browser. Cookies saved in users' browsers are always sent in API requests and if their size is too big the request will fail. I'm assuming that the Wunderkind team made a change around end of July that caused the cookie size to get too big

*Impact*
Unfortunately it's very hard to get business impact for this because it didnt affect 1 specific part of our application and we think the failures were intermittent. This likely affected users in a wide variety of ways, E.g. blocking some users in the funnel,  users just not seeing their pet name on the dashboard etc. This was also why it took us some time to identify the issue because it wasn't causing 1 big spike of failures in 1 API, but rather a small increase in failures across all our APIs. What we know is that it affected ~1000 users from July 30th - Aug 28th. (edited)

elements.text: Hey team, sharing this for visibility. We've just resolved an issue yesterday morning that has to do with Wunderkind.

Wunderkind was injecting a huge cookie into users' browsers which causes API requests to fail. We've contacted the Wunderkind team and they've reduced the cookie size yesterday morning which seems to have fully resolved the issue. Unfortunately it's hard for us to get a good understanding of the impact but what we know is that it caused random APIs to fail for ~1000 users from July 30th - Aug 28th

We noticed that there was spike of failures across all of our backend requests starting July 30th and identified that it's being caused by Wunderkind injecting a huge cookie into the browser. Cookies saved in users' browsers are always sent in API requests and if their size is too big the request will fail. I'm assuming that the Wunderkind team made a change around end of July that caused the cookie size to get too big

Unfortunately it's very hard to get business impact for this because it didnt affect 1 specific part of our application and we think the failures were intermittent. This likely affected users in a wide variety of ways, E.g. blocking some users in the funnel,  users just not seeing their pet name on the dashboard etc. This was also why it took us some time to identify the issue because it wasn't causing 1 big spike of failures in 1 API, but rather a small increase in failures across all our APIs. What we know is that it affected ~1000 users from July 30th - Aug 28th. (edited)

*Issue:* `/plans-quiz occasional loading failure`
*Topic:* `Pet Quiz`
*Description:* `I frequently QA marketing URLs to ensure that vouchers & other parameters are properly apprehended. Over the course of the last few weeks, there have been multiple cases where the /plans-quiz page does not load. It is inconsistent, though Lindsay also witnessed this on desktop. I have not been able to replicate on mobile.

Please see the screen recording under "Actual behaviour."`

*Actual behaviour:* `Quiz does not load:

_thread_replies.text:
Hey all, we took a look at this issue this morning and based on some debugging we think that this is a VPN issue on live, if you turn off the company VPN and refresh the website should load fine.

We're following up with app foundations team about this issue but we're not considering it urgent because based on the above we don't think it's affecting regular users, only ppl on the HF VPN. But if anyone sees anything that contradicts that pls let us know right away

cc: <@U3XBWJ3ND> <@U03TY4YJU4X>

elements.text:
Hey all, we took a look at this issue this morning and based on some debugging we think that this is a VPN issue on live, if you turn off the company VPN and refresh the website should load fine.

We're following up with app foundations team about this issue but we're not considering it urgent because based on the above we don't think it's affecting regular users, only ppl on the HF VPN. But if anyone sees anything that contradicts that pls let us know right away
